howTo.title: How to Use Middle English Translator

steps.name: Select Dialect and Period

funFacts.content: Did you know Chaucer often spelled 'through' ten different ways? That’s Middle English for you—full of quirks!
The letter ‘ȝ’ in Middle English is the ancestor of modern ‘y’. In Scottish names like ‘Menzies’, it’s pronounced /ˈmɪŋɪs/.
